title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 1 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 1 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 1 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 1.

questions.question: Who was strengthened in his kingdom and had the LORD God with him, as stated in 2 Chronicles 1:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:1 states that Solomon the son of David was strengthened in his kingdom, and the LORD his God was with him.

questions.question: To whom did Solomon speak according to 2 Chronicles 1:2?
options: Captains of thousands, judges, governors, and chief of fathers
questions.correctAnswer: Captains of thousands, judges, governors, and chief of fathers
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:2 says Solomon spoke to all Israel, including captains of thousands and hundreds, judges, governors, and chief of fathers.

questions.question: Where did Solomon and the congregation go to worship as noted in 2 Chronicles 1:3?
questions.correctAnswer: The high place at Gibeon
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:3 states that Solomon and all the congregation went to the high place at Gibeon, where the tabernacle of the congregation of God was.

questions.question: What had David brought up from Kirjathjearim according to 2 Chronicles 1:4?
questions.correctAnswer: The ark of God
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:4 explains that David had brought the ark of God from Kirjathjearim to the place he prepared in Jerusalem.

questions.question: Who made the brasen altar that Solomon put before the tabernacle as mentioned in 2 Chronicles 1:5?
options: Bezaleel, son of Uri, son of Hur
questions.correctAnswer: Bezaleel, son of Uri, son of Hur
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:5 states that the brasen altar was made by Bezaleel, son of Uri, son of Hur.

questions.question: How many burnt offerings did Solomon offer on the brasen altar according to 2 Chronicles 1:6?
questions.correctAnswer: One thousand
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:6 records that Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings on the brasen altar.

questions.question: What did God ask Solomon in a vision during the night, as recorded in 2 Chronicles 1:7?
options: Ask what I shall give thee
questions.correctAnswer: Ask what I shall give thee
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:7 states that God appeared to Solomon and said, 'Ask what I shall give thee.'

questions.question: What did Solomon ask God to give him according to 2 Chronicles 1:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom and knowledge
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:10 shows Solomon asking God for wisdom and knowledge to judge the people.

questions.question: True or False: Solomon asked God for riches, wealth, and honor instead of wisdom in 2 Chronicles 1.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:11 confirms Solomon did not ask for riches or honor but for wisdom and knowledge.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 1:12, what else did God promise Solomon besides wisdom and knowledge?
questions.correctAnswer: Riches, wealth, and honor
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:12 states God would give Solomon riches, wealth, and honor such as no king had before or after.

questions.question: How many chariots and horsemen did Solomon gather as stated in 2 Chronicles 1:14?
questions.correctAnswer: 1400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:14 records Solomon had 1400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen.

questions.question: True or False: Solomon made silver and gold in Jerusalem as plenteous as stones, as mentioned in 2 Chronicles 1:15.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:15 states that silver and gold were made as plenteous as stones in Jerusalem by Solomon.

questions.question: From which country did Solomon have horses brought out, according to 2 Chronicles 1:16?
questions.correctAnswer: Egypt
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:16 mentions Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Chronicles 1:17 mentions that horses were brought for all the kings of the Hittites and Syria.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:17 confirms that horses were brought for the kings of the Hittites and Syria by Solomon's merchants.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 2 Chronicles 1:9: '...for thou hast made me king over a people like the ______ of the earth in multitude.'
questions.correctAnswer: dust
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:9 says the people are like the dust of the earth in multitude.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 1 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 1 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with leadership responsibilities and asks for wisdom. Based on 2 Chronicles 1, what biblical truth would you share about seeking wisdom?
options: Ask God for wisdom and knowledge to lead well.
Seek wealth and honor to gain respect.
Rely on your own understanding without asking God.
Focus on defeating your enemies first.
questions.correctAnswer: Ask God for wisdom and knowledge to lead well.
questions.explanation: Solomon asked God for wisdom and knowledge to judge and lead the people (2 Chronicles 1:7-10). God honored this request because it was for righteous leadership and not selfish gain (2 Chronicles 1:11-12).

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 1 teach us about humility in prayer?
options: By asking God for wisdom instead of riches or honor.
By asking for long life and defeating enemies.
By demanding God fulfill all personal desires.
By praying only when in trouble.
questions.correctAnswer: By asking God for wisdom instead of riches or honor.
questions.explanation: Solomon showed humility by prioritizing wisdom and knowledge over riches, honor, or long life (2 Chronicles 1:10-11). This humility led to God granting him not only wisdom but also riches and honor (2 Chronicles 1:12).

questions.question: In what way does Solomon’s example in 2 Chronicles 1 encourage us about God's presence in our work?
options: God was with Solomon and strengthened his kingdom.
God allowed Solomon to succeed only because of his wealth.
Solomon worked alone without seeking God's help.
Solomon gained power through military might only.
questions.correctAnswer: God was with Solomon and strengthened his kingdom.
questions.explanation: The passage states that the LORD was with Solomon and magnified him exceedingly, showing that God’s presence strengthens and blesses our work when we seek Him (2 Chronicles 1:1).

questions.question: A believer is overwhelmed by the size of their responsibilities. Based on 2 Chronicles 1, what should they learn about trusting God in their service?
options: Trust God for wisdom to manage great responsibilities.
Try to do everything by themselves without help.
Focus only on small tasks and ignore bigger challenges.
Ask others to take all responsibility.
questions.correctAnswer: Trust God for wisdom to manage great responsibilities.
questions.explanation: Solomon recognized the enormity of judging so many people and trusted God for wisdom to lead well (2 Chronicles 1:9-10). This teaches reliance on God’s guidance in overwhelming tasks.

questions.question: How does Solomon’s prayer in 2 Chronicles 1 demonstrate a proper heart attitude toward God's blessings?
options: He asked for wisdom to serve others, not for selfish gain.
He demanded riches and power first.
He prayed only for personal protection.
He asked God to bless his enemies.
questions.correctAnswer: He asked for wisdom to serve others, not for selfish gain.
questions.explanation: Solomon’s prayer focused on wisdom to judge and serve God’s people rather than seeking wealth or honor for himself (2 Chronicles 1:10-11), showing a heart oriented toward service.

questions.question: Based on 2 Chronicles 1, what biblical principle about stewardship can be learned from Solomon’s reign?
options: Diligent gathering and managing resources with wisdom.
Ignoring resources and relying on luck.
Using resources only for personal luxury.
questions.correctAnswer: Diligent gathering and managing resources with wisdom.
questions.explanation: Solomon gathered chariots, horses, silver, gold, and cedar trees abundantly, showing wise stewardship and management of resources given by God (2 Chronicles 1:14-15).

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 1 teach about the importance of worship and seeking God personally?
options: Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings and sought God at the tabernacle.
Solomon ignored worship and focused on politics.
God only appears to those with military power.
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings and sought God at the tabernacle.
questions.explanation: Solomon’s act of offering many burnt offerings and seeking God at Gibeon highlights the importance of personal devotion and worship in leadership and daily life (2 Chronicles 1:5-6).

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 1, Solomon received wisdom because he first asked for wealth and honor.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: God granted Solomon wisdom specifically because he did not ask for riches, honor, or long life, but for wisdom to lead the people (2 Chronicles 1:10-12).

questions.question: True or False: Solomon’s accumulation of horses and chariots was contrary to God’s blessing and wisdom.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The chapter shows Solomon gathering horses and chariots as part of his reign, which God blessed along with wisdom, riches, and honor (2 Chronicles 1:14-17).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Solomon asked God for ______ and knowledge so he could judge the people rightly.
questions.correctAnswer: wisdom
questions.explanation: Solomon specifically asked for wisdom and knowledge to lead and judge the people well (2 Chronicles 1:10-11).

questions.question: What practical lesson about prayer can be drawn from God’s response to Solomon’s request in 2 Chronicles 1?
options: God honors prayers that seek His kingdom’s good over selfish desires.
God only answers prayers that demand immediate results.
Prayers should focus on personal wealth first.
It is better not to pray than to ask for wisdom.
questions.correctAnswer: God honors prayers that seek His kingdom’s good over selfish desires.
questions.explanation: God praised Solomon for not asking for selfish things but seeking wisdom to lead the people, rewarding him with wisdom and also riches and honor (2 Chronicles 1:11-12).

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 1 illustrate the importance of faith and trust in God for success?
options: Solomon was strengthened because the LORD was with him.
Solomon succeeded solely because of his own power.
Faith was not important to Solomon’s reign.
Solomon ignored God and trusted in horses and chariots.
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon was strengthened because the LORD was with him.
questions.explanation: The chapter opens with stating that Solomon was strengthened because the LORD was with him and magnified him exceedingly (2 Chronicles 1:1), showing the importance of faith and trust in God.

questions.question: What does Solomon’s act of going to the high place at Gibeon teach us about spiritual discipline?
options: Seeking God regularly in designated places fosters spiritual growth.
Spiritual discipline is unnecessary for leadership.
God only meets people in Jerusalem.
Worship is only about rituals, not relationship.
questions.correctAnswer: Seeking God regularly in designated places fosters spiritual growth.
questions.explanation: Solomon and the congregation went to the high place to worship and seek God, demonstrating the value of consistent spiritual discipline and fellowship (2 Chronicles 1:3-6).

questions.question: Based on 2 Chronicles 1, what biblical insight about contentment can be shared with someone desiring more material wealth?
options: True contentment begins with valuing wisdom and God’s favor over riches.
Only wealth can bring lasting contentment.
Contentment comes from acquiring horses and chariots.
questions.correctAnswer: True contentment begins with valuing wisdom and God’s favor over riches.
questions.explanation: Solomon’s request for wisdom instead of wealth initially, and God’s blessing him with both, teaches that contentment starts with seeking God’s wisdom and favor rather than just material gain (2 Chronicles 1:10-12).

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 1 encourage believers to approach their responsibilities in family and community?
options: By seeking God’s wisdom to lead and care for others well.
By focusing only on personal gain and ignoring others.
By avoiding responsibility to prevent failure.
questions.correctAnswer: By seeking God’s wisdom to lead and care for others well.
questions.explanation: Solomon’s example shows that leadership and care in community and family require God’s wisdom and guidance, which he sought earnestly (2 Chronicles 1:10-11).

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 1 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 1.

questions.question: To whom did Solomon speak when he called the leaders of Israel together before going to Gibeon?
options: Captains of thousands and hundreds, judges, governors, and chief of the fathers
questions.correctAnswer: Captains of thousands and hundreds, judges, governors, and chief of the fathers
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:2 states that Solomon spoke unto all Israel, specifically mentioning captains of thousands and hundreds, judges, governors, and chief of the fathers.

questions.question: What is the significance of the high place at Gibeon where Solomon and the congregation went?
options: It was where the tabernacle of the congregation of God, made by Moses, was located
It was the site of Solomon’s palace
It was the location where the Ark of the Covenant was kept
It was the main city of Solomon’s kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: It was where the tabernacle of the congregation of God, made by Moses, was located
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:3 explains that Solomon and the congregation went to the high place at Gibeon because there was the tabernacle of the congregation of God made by Moses.

questions.question: Where had David placed the Ark of God according to 2 Chronicles 1?
options: In a tent he had pitched in Jerusalem
At the high place in Gibeon
In the tabernacle made by Moses
In the temple Solomon would build
questions.correctAnswer: In a tent he had pitched in Jerusalem
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:4 states that David had brought up the Ark from Kirjathjearim and had pitched a tent for it in Jerusalem.

questions.question: Who made the brass altar that Solomon used for offering sacrifices?
options: Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur
Moses the servant of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:5 mentions that the brass altar was made by Bezaleel, son of Uri, son of Hur.

questions.question: How many burnt offerings did Solomon offer at the brass altar at Gibeon?
questions.correctAnswer: One thousand
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:6 states that Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings upon the brass altar before the LORD.

questions.question: What did God offer Solomon in a dream at night?
options: Ask what I shall give thee
questions.correctAnswer: Ask what I shall give thee
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:7 records God appearing to Solomon and inviting him to ask what He should give him.

questions.question: What did Solomon request from God when given the choice?
options: Wisdom and knowledge to judge the people
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom and knowledge to judge the people
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:10 shows Solomon asking for wisdom and knowledge to govern and judge the great people God had given him.

questions.question: Which of the following did Solomon specifically NOT ask for, according to God's response?
options: Riches, wealth, honour, long life, or the death of his enemies
questions.correctAnswer: Riches, wealth, honour, long life, or the death of his enemies
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:11 states Solomon did not ask for riches, wealth, honour, nor long life, nor the death of his enemies, but asked for wisdom and knowledge.

questions.question: What blessings did God promise Solomon in addition to wisdom and knowledge?
options: Riches, wealth, and honour such as no king before or after him would have
Only peace and a long reign
A vast empire extending beyond Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Riches, wealth, and honour such as no king before or after him would have
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:12 records God promising Solomon wisdom and knowledge, plus unparalleled riches, wealth, and honour.

questions.question: How many chariots and horsemen did Solomon gather according to this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: 1400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:14 states Solomon gathered 1400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen.

questions.question: From where did Solomon import horses and linen yarn?
questions.correctAnswer: Egypt
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:16 mentions Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt and also linen yarn from there.

questions.question: What was the price of a chariot and a horse Solomon’s merchants obtained from Egypt?
options: Chariot for 600 shekels of silver, horse for 150 shekels
Chariot for 150 shekels, horse for 600 shekels
Chariot for 1000 shekels, horse for 200 shekels
Chariot and horse both for 500 shekels each
questions.correctAnswer: Chariot for 600 shekels of silver, horse for 150 shekels
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:17 specifies the price as 600 shekels for a chariot and 150 shekels for a horse.

questions.question: True or False: The Ark of the Covenant was still kept at the tabernacle in Gibeon during Solomon’s reign.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:4 clarifies that the Ark was brought by David to Jerusalem, not kept at Gibeon.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Solomon offered a thousand _____ offerings on the brass altar before the LORD.
questions.correctAnswer: burnt
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:6 states Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings on the brass altar.

questions.question: Solomon’s request for wisdom and knowledge is a typological foreshadowing of which New Testament figure known for divine wisdom?
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Solomon’s request and God’s granting of wisdom foreshadow the divine wisdom fully embodied in Jesus Christ, who is called the wisdom of God in the New Testament (cf. 1 Corinthians 1:24).

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 1 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 1 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the spiritual condition of Solomon's kingdom as described at the beginning of 2 Chronicles 1?
options: Solomon was strengthened and the LORD magnified him exceedingly
Solomon struggled to maintain his kingdom
The kingdom was in rebellion against God
Solomon was weak and God was displeased
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon was strengthened and the LORD magnified him exceedingly
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:1 states Solomon was strengthened in his kingdom and the LORD was with him and magnified him exceedingly, showing divine favor and empowerment. Similarly, Psalm 21:1 and Isaiah 41:10 affirm God's strengthening of His anointed.

questions.question: To whom did Solomon speak when he summoned the leaders of Israel?
options: Captains of thousands and hundreds, judges, governors, and chiefs of the fathers
questions.correctAnswer: Captains of thousands and hundreds, judges, governors, and chiefs of the fathers
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:2 shows Solomon addressed the military leaders, judicial authorities, and tribal heads, highlighting his role over all civil and military governance. This reflects God's design for order in Israel (Exodus 18:21; Deuteronomy 1:13).

questions.question: Why did Solomon and the congregation go to the high place at Gibeon?
options: Because the tabernacle of the congregation of God was there
Because the temple was not yet built in Jerusalem
Because it was the geographical center of Israel
Because it was the place where David was anointed
questions.correctAnswer: Because the tabernacle of the congregation of God was there
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:3 states they went to Gibeon because the tabernacle made by Moses was there, emphasizing God's presence dwelling with His people in the wilderness pattern (Exodus 40:2-33; Numbers 10:11-12).

questions.question: What significant object had David prepared a place for in Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: The ark of God
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:4 notes David brought the ark from Kirjathjearim to Jerusalem and had pitched a tent for it there, signifying God's covenant presence among His people (Exodus 25:10-22; 1 Samuel 7:1-2).

questions.question: Who made the brazen altar that Solomon put before the tabernacle?
options: Bezaleel, son of Uri, son of Hur
Hur, the leader in the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: Bezaleel, son of Uri, son of Hur
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:5 identifies Bezaleel as the craftsman of the brazen altar, recalling his divinely gifted craftsmanship in Exodus 31:1-6 and 38:1-7, showing God's provision for sacred worship.

questions.question: How many burnt offerings did Solomon offer on the brazen altar?
questions.correctAnswer: One thousand
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:6 states Solomon offered a thousand burnt offerings, which signifies a substantial act of worship and dedication, consistent with the sacrificial system's role in atonement and covenant renewal (Leviticus 1:1-17; Numbers 28:3-8).

questions.question: What did God offer to Solomon in a night vision?
options: Ask what I shall give thee
Go forth and conquer your enemies
I will make you king forever
questions.correctAnswer: Ask what I shall give thee
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:7 records God's invitation for Solomon to ask for what he desires, highlighting God's sovereignty and grace in granting the desires of a righteous heart (1 Kings 3:5-14; Psalm 37:4).

questions.question: What did Solomon specifically request from God?
options: Wisdom and knowledge to judge the people
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom and knowledge to judge the people
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:10 shows Solomon asking for wisdom and knowledge to govern Israel well, demonstrating humility and prioritizing God's purpose, consistent with Proverbs 2:6 and James 1:5.

questions.question: Why did God grant Solomon wisdom and also riches, wealth, and honor?
options: Because Solomon asked for wisdom and not riches or long life
Because Solomon was the son of David
questions.correctAnswer: Because Solomon asked for wisdom and not riches or long life
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:11-12 explains God rewarded Solomon’s selfless request for wisdom by also granting wealth and honor, illustrating God's bounty for godly priorities (Proverbs 3:13-16; Matthew 6:33).

questions.question: What was the extent of Solomon's military forces as described in this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:14 details Solomon’s military strength, showing God’s blessing on his reign and the establishment of peace and order, aligning with 1 Kings 10:26 and Exodus 15:3.

questions.question: How does Solomon’s accumulation of wealth and resources demonstrate God’s blessing?
options: He made silver and gold as plenteous as stones and cedar trees as abundant as sycamores
He amassed treasures hidden in secret chambers
questions.correctAnswer: He made silver and gold as plenteous as stones and cedar trees as abundant as sycamores
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:15 describes Solomon’s abundant wealth and resources, indicating God’s provision in his reign, consistent with Deuteronomy 8:18 and Psalm 112:3.

questions.question: From which country did Solomon import horses and linen yarn?
questions.correctAnswer: Egypt
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:16 states Solomon imported horses and linen yarn from Egypt, illustrating international trade and economic prosperity under God's blessing (1 Kings 10:28-29; Psalm 72:10).

questions.question: What was the price of a chariot and a horse Solomon imported from Egypt?
options: Six hundred shekels of silver for a chariot, and one hundred and fifty for a horse
One thousand shekels for a chariot, and three hundred for a horse
Five hundred shekels for each chariot and horse
Two hundred shekels for a chariot and fifty for a horse
questions.correctAnswer: Six hundred shekels of silver for a chariot, and one hundred and fifty for a horse
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 1:17 specifies the cost, reflecting the economic value and Solomon’s wealth. This also points to the strategic military and trade policies God enabled (1 Kings 10:29; Jeremiah 46:9).

questions.question: What does Solomon’s request for wisdom imply about the nature of godly leadership?
options: It requires discernment to govern rightly over God’s people
It is primarily about accumulating wealth
It focuses on extending one’s reign indefinitely
questions.correctAnswer: It requires discernment to govern rightly over God’s people
questions.explanation: Solomon’s request (2 Chronicles 1:10) shows godly leadership is rooted in wisdom to judge rightly, consistent with Proverbs 8:15-16 and Romans 13:1-4, reflecting the divine mandate for righteous rule.

questions.question: What theological truth is demonstrated by God appearing to Solomon and granting his request?
options: God is sovereign and gracious to bless according to righteous desires
God is distant and unresponsive to human requests
God demands human works before granting blessings
questions.correctAnswer: God is sovereign and gracious to bless according to righteous desires
questions.explanation: God’s appearance and granting of Solomon’s request in 2 Chronicles 1:7-12 reveals His sovereignty and grace, consistent with passages like James 4:6 and Psalm 145:19 highlighting God’s responsiveness to humble prayers.
